vjdbv0.3_description: GenBank Accession ID = NCBI Accession, ENA, DDBJ (INSDC)
Assembly ID of the sequence (INSDC)
References the BioProject Accession (ID) (INSDC)
References the BioSample Accession (ID) (INSDC)
Date when the sample was collected
Country or sea area where the sample was collected
Virus family name of the sample based on NCBI data
Title name of the sequnce based on GenBank entry
This sequence is a GenBank sequence
This sequence is a reference sequence
Additional information, e.g. Isolate, Genotype
Virus genus name of the sample based on NCBI data
City where the sample was collected
Name of the country may contain the state name
Common name of the natural host, e.g. human
Individual isolate from which the sample was obtained
Length of the sequence
Molecule of the sequence, e.g. ssRNA
Wether the sequence is a partial or complete sequence
Gen Bank organism name, a taxonomic name at species level or below the species level.
Organization the submitter(s) is(are) affiliated with
Date when the sequence was released into a repository (GenBank, BV-BRC)
Name of the virus segment
NCBI Taxonomy scientific species name
NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA) accession ID
Submitter of the sequence
Tissue that was selected from the host
State/Region where the sample was collected
ENA analysis identifier
Free text description of the genome assembly
Assembly level (contig, scaffold, chromosome, complete genome)
Minimum length of consecutive Ns to be considered a gap
The assembly program
‘clone or isolate’
BV-BRC genome ID
Name of the institution to which the person collecting the specimen belongs
Health state of the host at the time of collection, e.g. diseased or healthy
The geographic location by latitude, where the sample was collected (DD)
The geographic location by longitude, where the sample was collected (DD)
Continent where the sample was collected
Describes the physical, environmental or local geographical source of the sample, e.g. soil
Name of the person that collected the sample
CORONA: The cuttoff used to determine if the sample is seropositive
References a ENA assembly to an ENA Experiment (could be redundant with Run)
Host age
Unit that describes the host age
Natural behaviour of the host
Main host disease diagnosis
Disease outcome in the host

The symptoms that have been reported in relation to the illness, such as cough, diarrhea, fever, headache, malaise, myalgia, nausea, runny_nose, shortness_of_breath, sore_throat. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon.
Taxonomic group of the host
Natural habitat of the avian or mammalian host
BVBRC Lab Host; common name of the lab host
NCBI Tax ID of the lab host
Species of the lab host. Scientific name of the host
Species of the natural host. Scientific name of the host
NCBI Tax ID of the natural host
Sex of the host
Unique ID by which singular subjects can be referred to
INFLUENZA: Method used to assess if a sample if flu positive/negative. When multiple once were used they are seperated by semicolon
INFLUENZA: Result of the given methods. Positive(P) or Negative(N). For multiple test the results are delimited by semicolon, e.g. P; P
INFLUENZA: Influenza virus classification
Boolean flag -- if record is in the BVRC then "yes"
INFLUENZA: The test result for other tested pathogens given as described by influenza test result
INFLUENZA: Was the sample tested for other pathogens? Insert the pathogenic organisms using semicolon as a delimiter, e.g. Newcastle. “None” is also valid
Lineage determined by Pangolin
Pangolin version used to determine the lineage
If the sample was only received and not collected provide the receipt date
RKI ID to link sequence and metadata
References a ENA assembly to an ENA Run
Additional information, e.g. Isolate, Genotype
NCBI Tax ID of the sample species
Serological variety of a species characterised by its antigenic properties, e.g. H1N1
Common abbreviations of the species name
NCBI Tax ID of the species
Average sequencing depth across the sequence
Percentage of GC in the sequence
Percentage of Ns within the whole sequence
Generic name of the sequence (Name of the entry)
Number of contigs in the sequence
Sequence publication doi
Sequence publication pubmed ID
Last update date of the sequence in BVBRC (whole entry)
Version of the sequence (whole entry)
Institution that sequenced the sample
Insert size for paired reads
Instrument model used for sequencing
The protocol used to construct the library.
The design of the library including details of how it was constructed.
The library layout specifies whether to expect single or paired configuration of reads.
The name for the library if any.
The method used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced.
The library_source specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced.
The sequencing technique intended for this library.
Instrument platform used for sequencing, multiple are seperated (only for assemblys)
Why was the sample sequenced?
The name of the database where the sequence was originally released
Country of the submmiter institute
Country or location of the organization of the submitters.
BVBRC NCBI TaxIDs of the lineage
VirJenDB sequence ID
Unique ID given by the investigator as strain might not be unique
